body:
# hermes-crystal

#### A crystal wrapper around the hermes protocol

## Context

The `hermes-crystal` library provides bindings for the Hermes protocol that Snips components use to communicate together. `hermes-crystal` allows you to interface seamlessly with the Snips platform and create Voice applications with ease!

`hermes-crystal` abstracts away the connection to the MQTT bus and the parsing of incoming and outcoming messages from and to the components of the platform and provides a high-level API as well.

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

```yaml
dependencies:
  hermes-crystal:
    github: elbywan/hermes-crystal
```

2. Run `shards install`

## Usage

```crystal
require "hermes-crystal"
```

## Documentation

Hosted [here](https://elbywan.github.io/hermes-crystal).

## Development

Development tasks are defined in the [`sam.cr`](https://github.com/imdrasil/sam.cr) file.

Use `make sam help` to display the list of available tasks.

## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/elbywan/hermes-crystal/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [elbywan](https://github.com/elbywan) - creator and maintainer

instance_methods.name: subscribe_intent
instance_methods.doc: Subscribe to intent events.
instance_methods.summary: Subscribe to intent events.

def.name: subscribe_intent
def.body:
if @subscriptions.has_key?("intent")
else
  @subscriptions["intent"] = [] of ::Pointer(Void)
  dispatcher = ->(message : ::Pointer(LibHermes::CIntentMessage), boxed_subscriptions : ::Pointer(Void)) do
    subscriptions = Box(Hash(String, Array(::Pointer(Void)))).unbox(boxed_subscriptions)
    subscriptions["intent"].each do |boxed_callback|
      (Box((LibHermes::CIntentMessage -> Void)).unbox(boxed_callback)).call(message.value)
    end
    LibHermes.hermes_drop_intent_message(message)
  end
  call!(LibHermes.hermes_dialogue_subscribe_intent(@facade, *extra_args, dispatcher))
end
if once
  delete_callback = uninitialized (-> Nil)
  boxed_callback = Box.box(->(message : LibHermes::CIntentMessage) do
    callback.call(message)
    delete_callback.call
  end)
  delete_callback = -> do
    @subscriptions["intent"].delete(boxed_callback)
  end
else
  boxed_callback = Box.box(callback)
end
@subscriptions["intent"] << boxed_callback
boxed_callback

types.name: Bindings
types.doc:
Contains low level bindings to the hermes library.

**This module is not meant to be used internally, as opposed to the `Mappings` module.**
types.summary: Contains low level bindings to the hermes library.

def.name: call!
def.body:
if result == SnipsResult::Ko
  LibHermes.hermes_get_last_error(out error)
  raise(String.new(error))
end

def.name: assign
mapping

struct_map

constants.summary: The resolved value has a granularity of a quarter.

constants.summary: The resolved value has a granularity of a minute.

constants.summary: The resolved value has a granularity of a second.

types.summary: Enum representing the grain of a resolved date related value.

types.summary: Describes Snips components that are part of the platform.

constants.summary: Remove previously injected data before adding new data.

types.doc: Type of injection supported.
types.summary: Type of injection supported.

types.name: SnipsPrecision
types.doc: Enum describing the precision of a resolved value.
types.summary: Enum describing the precision of a resolved value.

types.name: SnipsResult

constants.name: Ko
constants.doc: The function encountered an error, you can retrieve it using the dedicated function `hermes_get_last_error`.
constants.summary: The function encountered an error, you can retrieve it using the dedicated function hermes_get_last_error.

types.doc: The result of a call to the hermes library.
types.summary: The result of a call to the hermes library.

types.name: SnipsSessionInitType

constants.name: Action
constants.doc:
The session expects a response from the user.
Users responses will be provided in the form of `CIntentMessage`s.
constants.summary: The session expects a response from the user.

constants.name: Notification
constants.doc:
The session doesn't expect a response from the user. If the session cannot be started, it
will be enqueued.
constants.summary: The session doesn't expect a response from the user.

types.doc: The type of sessions that can be initiated programatically.
types.summary: The type of sessions that can be initiated programatically.

types.name: SnipsSessionTerminationType

constants.name: SiteUnavailable
constants.doc: Dialogue was deactivated on the site the session requested.
constants.summary: Dialogue was deactivated on the site the session requested.

constants.name: IntentNotRecognized
constants.doc: The platform didn't understand was the user said.
constants.summary: The platform didn't understand was the user said.

constants.name: Timeout
constants.doc: No response was received from one of the components in a timely manner.
constants.summary: No response was received from one of the components in a timely manner.

types.doc: The reasons that caused a session termination.
types.summary: The reasons that caused a session termination.

types.name: SnipsSlotValueType
types.doc: The type of slot values that are supported by Snips, either custom or built in.
types.summary: The type of slot values that are supported by Snips, either custom or built in.

types.name: Hermes
types.doc:
Hermes-crystal is an high level API that allows you to
subscribe and send Snips messages using the Hermes protocol.
types.summary: Hermes-crystal is an high level API that allows you to subscribe and send Snips messages using the Hermes protocol.

types.name: Mappings
types.doc:
**Contains high-level serializable mappings to the hermes library data structures.**

When using publish or subscribe functions, the classes defined in this module
will be used in place of the low level c structures.

These classes are very handy since they can be initialized using plain records and arrays.
They also implement the `to_unsafe` method and can be converted from and to c structures easily.
types.summary: Contains high-level serializable mappings to the hermes library data structures.

types.name: ActionSessionInit
types.doc:
Data used to initialize a session of type "Action".

- text [`String`] : If defined, a text to speak when the session is started.
- intent_filter [`StringArray`] : Nullable, an optional list of intent name to restrict the parsing of the user response to.
- can_be_enqueued [`Bool`] : A boolean to indicate if the session can be enqueued if it can't be started immediately.
- send_intent_not_recognized [`Bool`] :
A boolean to indicate whether the dialogue manager should handle non recognized intents by
itself or sent them as an `CIntentNotRecognizedMessage` for the client to handle. This
setting applies only to the next conversation turn.
types.summary: Data used to initialize a session of type "Action".

instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` if this reference is the same as *other*. Invokes `same?`.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if this reference is the same as other.

def.body:
if @data == (other.@data)
else
  return false
end
true

def.name: to_unsafe
def.body:
c_data = LibHermes::CActionSessionInit.new
assign(text)
assign(intent_filter) do
  @data["intent_filter"].try do |i|
    ptr_alloc(i.to_unsafe)
  end
end
assign_bool(can_be_enqueued)
assign_bool(send_intent_not_recognized)
c_data

types.name: DataType
types.aliased: NamedTuple(text: String | Nil, intent_filter: Mappings::StringArray | Nil, can_be_enqueued: Bool, send_intent_not_recognized: Bool)

types.name: AmountOfMoneyValue
types.doc:
An amount of money slot value.

- unit [`String`] : The currency.
- value [`Float32`] : The amount of money.
- precision [`SnipsPrecision`] : The precision of the resolved value.
types.summary: An amount of money slot value.

def.body:
if @data == (other.@data)
else

true

def.body:
c_data = LibHermes::CAmountOfMoneyValue.new
assign(unit)
assign(value)
assign(precision)
c_data

types.aliased: NamedTuple(unit: String, value: Float32, precision: Enums::SnipsPrecision)

types.doc:
An ASR decoding duration.

- start [`Float32`] : The beginning of the decoding.
- end [`Float32`] : The end of the decoding.
types.summary: An ASR decoding duration.

if @data == (other.@data)

true

types.name: DataType
types.aliased: NamedTuple(start: Float32, end_: Float32)

types.name: AsrToken
types.doc:
An ASR token.

- value [`String`] : The text value decoded in the token.
- confidence [`Float32`] : The confidence score.
- range_start [`Int32`] : The beginning of the range in the whole text.
- range_end [`Int32`] : The end of the range in the whole text.
- time [`AsrDecodingDuration`] : The time at which the token was spoken.
types.summary: An ASR token.

instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` if this reference is the same as *other*. Invokes `same?`.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if this reference is the same as other.

def.body:
if @data == (other.@data)
else
  return false
end
true

def.body:

types.name: ContinueSessionMessage
types.doc:
A message used to continue a session.

- session_id [`String`] : The id of the session this action applies to.
- text [`String`] : The text to say to the user.
- intent_filter [`StringArray`] : Nullable, an optional list of intent name to restrict the parsing of the user response to.
- custom_data [`String`] : Optional data that will be passed to the next session event.
- slot : [`String`] :
 Nullable,  An optional string, requires `intent_filter` to contain a single value. If set,
the dialogue engine will not run the the intent classification on the user response and go
straight to slot filling, assuming the intent is the one passed in the `intent_filter`, and
searching the value of the given slot.
- send_intent_not_recognized [`Bool`] :
A boolean to indicate whether the dialogue manager should handle not recognized
intents by itself or sent them as a `CIntentNotRecognizedMessage` for the client to handle.
This setting applies only to the next conversation turn. The default value is false (and
the dialogue manager will handle non recognized intents by itself).
types.summary: A message used to continue a session.

instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` if this reference is the same as *other*. Invokes `same?`.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if this reference is the same as other.

def.body:
if @data == (other.@data)
else
  return false
end
true

def.name: to_unsafe
def.body:
c_data = LibHermes::CContinueSessionMessage.new
assign(session_id)
assign(text)
assign(intent_filter) do
  @data["intent_filter"].try do |i|
    ptr_alloc(i.to_unsafe)
  end
end
assign(custom_data)
assign(slot)
assign_bool(send_intent_not_recognized)
c_data

types.name: DataType
types.aliased: NamedTuple(session_id: String, text: String, intent_filter: Mappings::StringArray | Nil, custom_data: String | Nil, slot: String | Nil, send_intent_not_recognized: Bool)

types.name: IntentMessage
types.doc:
A message sent on intent detection.

- session_id [`String`] : The session identifier in which this intent was detected.
- custom_data [`String`] : Nullable, the custom data that was given at the session creation.
- site_id [`String`] : The site where the intent was detected.
- input [`String`] : The input that generated this intent.
- intent [`NluIntentClassifierResult`] : The result of the intent classification.
- slots [`NluSlotArray`] : Nullable, the detected slots, if any.
- alternatives [`NluIntentAlternativeArray`] : Nullable, alternatives intent resolutions.
- asr_tokens [`AsrTokenDoubleArray`] :
Nullable, the tokens detected by the ASR, the first array level represents the asr
invocation, the second one the tokens.
- asr_confidence [`Float32`] :
Confidence of the asr capture, this value is optional. Any value not in [0,1] should be ignored.
types.summary: A message sent on intent detection.

instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` if this reference is the same as *other*. Invokes `same?`.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if this reference is the same as other.

def.body:
if @data == (other.@data)
else
  return false
end
true

def.name: to_unsafe
def.body:
c_data = LibHermes::CIntentMessage.new
assign(session_id)
assign(custom_data)
assign(site_id)
assign(input)
assign(intent) do
  ptr_alloc(intent.to_unsafe)
end
assign(slots) do
  ptr_alloc(slots.to_unsafe)
end
assign(alternatives) do
  ptr_alloc(alternatives.to_unsafe)
end
assign(asr_tokens) do
  ptr_alloc(asr_tokens.to_unsafe)
end
assign(asr_confidence)
c_data

types.aliased: NamedTuple(session_id: String, custom_data: String | Nil, site_id: String, input: String, intent: Mappings::NluIntentClassifierResult, slots: Mappings::NluSlotArray | Nil, alternatives: Mappings::NluIntentAlternativeArray | Nil, asr_tokens: Mappings::AsrTokenDoubleArray | Nil, asr_confidence: Float32)

types.name: MqttOptions
types.doc:
A class representing the configuration of the MQTT client.

- broker_address: Address of the MQTT broker in the form `ip:port`.
- username: Username to use to connect to the broker. Nullable.
- password: Password to use to connect to the broker. Nullable.
- tls_hostname: Hostname to use for the TLS configuration. Nullable, setting a value enables TLS.
- tls_ca_file: CA files to use if TLS is enabled. Nullable.
- tls_ca_path: CA path to use if TLS is enabled. Nullable.
- tls_client_key: Client key to use if TLS is enabled. Nullable.
- tls_client_cert: Client cert to use if TLS is enabled. Nullable.
- tls_disable_root_store: Boolean indicating if the root store should be disabled if TLS is enabled.
types.summary: A class representing the configuration of the MQTT client.

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (broker_address = "", username = "", password = "", tls_hostname = "", tls_ca_file = [] of String, tls_ca_path = [] of String, tls_client_key = "", tls_client_cert = "", tls_disable_root_store : UInt8 = 0)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(broker_address, username, password, tls_hostname, tls_ca_file, tls_ca_path, tls_client_key, tls_client_cert, tls_disable_root_store)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: to_unsafe
def.body:
c_message = LibHermes::CMqttOptions.new
if @broker_address.empty?
else
  c_message.broker_address = @broker_address
end
if @username.empty?
else
  c_message.username = @username
end
if @password.empty?
else
  c_message.password = @password
end
if @tls_hostname.empty?
else
  c_message.tls_hostname = @tls_hostname
end
tls_ca_file = (StringArray.new(@tls_ca_file)).to_unsafe
c_message.tls_ca_file = pointerof(tls_ca_file)
tls_ca_path = (StringArray.new(@tls_ca_path)).to_unsafe
c_message.tls_ca_path = pointerof(tls_ca_path)
if @tls_client_key.empty?
else
  c_message.tls_client_key = @tls_client_key
end
if @tls_client_cert.empty?
else
  c_message.tls_client_cert = @tls_client_cert
end
c_message.tls_disable_root_store = @tls_disable_root_store
c_message

types.name: Slot
types.doc:
Slot data.

- value [`SlotValue`] : The resolved value of the slot.
- alternatives [`SlotValueArray`] : The alternative slot values.
- raw_value [`String`] : The raw value as it appears in the input text.
- entity [`String`] : Name of the entity type of the slot.
- slot_name [`String`] : Name of the slot.
- range_start [`Int32`] : Start index of raw value in input text.
- range_end [`Int32`] : End index of raw value in input text.
- confidence_score [`Float32`] : Confidence score of the slot.
types.summary: Slot data.

def.name: to_unsafe
def.body:
c_data = LibHermes::CSlotValue.new
c_data.value_type = @data["value_type"]
case data = @data["value"]
when String
  c_data.value = data.to_unsafe.as(::Pointer(Void))
when LibC::Double
  ptr = Pointer.malloc(size: sizeof(LibC::Double), value: data)
  c_data.value = ptr.as(::Pointer(Void))
when LibC::LongLong
  ptr = Pointer.malloc(size: sizeof(LibC::LongLong), value: data)
  c_data.value = ptr.as(::Pointer(Void))
when InstantTimeValue
  c_data.value = (ptr_alloc(data.to_unsafe)).as(::Pointer(Void))
when TimeIntervalValue
  c_data.value = (ptr_alloc(data.to_unsafe)).as(::Pointer(Void))
when AmountOfMoneyValue
  c_data.value = (ptr_alloc(data.to_unsafe)).as(::Pointer(Void))
when TemperatureValue
  c_data.value = (ptr_alloc(data.to_unsafe)).as(::Pointer(Void))
when DurationValue
  c_data.value = (ptr_alloc(data.to_unsafe)).as(::Pointer(Void))
end
c_data
